title: Rebooting .Gov
abstract:
Rebooting .Gov
Government’s most important “product” is information, but the last major upgrade in how the 
United States disburses and receives information from citizens was in 1994 when Gingrich put 
the Congress on the net and Clinton did the same with the White House.  This policy proposal 
uses the Government Printing Ofﬁce as the center for a 4-point plan that would dramatically 
change how the U.S. Government presents itself to the world.
The First 100 Days
The Government Printing Office
